definition: A fundamental unit of matter that retains its chemical properties in chemical reactions, typically composed of a positively charged nucleus and negatively charged electrons orbiting around it. It is commonly referred to in the context of physics, chemistry, and atomic theory.

examples.german: Das Atom besteht aus einem Atomkern und Elektronen.
examples.english: The atom consists of a nucleus and electrons.

examples.german: Die Kernspaltung eines Atoms kann Energie freisetzen.
examples.english: Nuclear fission of an atom can release energy.

examples.german: Das Atommodell von Bohr beschreibt Elektronen in Schalen um den Atomkern.
examples.english: Bohr's atomic model describes electrons in shells around the nucleus.

examples.german: Die Anzahl der Protonen im Atomkern bestimmt das chemische Element.
examples.english: The number of protons in the nucleus determines the chemical element.

examples.german: Ein Atom ist die kleinste Einheit eines chemischen Elements.
examples.english: An atom is the smallest unit of a chemical element.
